abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Safety Net Adjustment Loan
            Project (SSNAL) provides balance of payments and budgetary
            assistance to Indonesia to support improvements in the
            functioning of the country's social safety net
            operations through policy reforms and actions in two areas:
            safeguarding key safety net programs (SSN) and improving
            program design. To achieve the aim of safeguarding SSN, the
            loan supports the creation of an overarching national
            structure with three major components: a government team, a
            joint government and civil society effort in a "control
            team," and a completely independent civil society
            monitoring function. The joint government and civil society
            effort will oversee the implementation of a five-fold
            strategy for each of five key social safety net programs,
            which include internal monitoring and operational controls,
            independent verification of program performance and
            monitoring reports, information campaigns to reach the
            grassroots level, a complaint resolution mechanism that will
            be supervised by the control team, and civil society
            involvement at every level of monitoring. To improve program
            design, the loan supports better geographical targeting and
            application of international best practice, taking into
            account field-based evaluations of on-going activities, so
            that the poor are more effectively reached.
